DOC.brief_title: Sinew Acupuncture Neck Pain : Randomized Controlled Trial
DOC.detailed_description: Objectives : Sinew acupuncture superficial needling technique advantage minimal pain , feasible manipulation , apparent adverse effect . The proposal aim examine efficacy safety sinew acupuncture chronic mechanical neck pain ( CMNP ) . Hypothesis test : Sinew acupuncture reduce pain intensity , improve neck pain disability health-related quality life without significant side effect CMNP subject compare sham acupuncture treatment . Design : A randomized , subject- assessor-blind , sham acupuncture-controlled clinical trial Participants : Subjects ( N=130 ) randomize sinew acupuncture sham acupuncture group ( 1:1 ratio ) . Study instrument : Visual Analog Scale ( VAS ) , Northwick Park Neck Pain Questionnaire ( NPQ ) Short Form-36 ( SF-36 ) Intervention : Sinew acupuncture group receive five session needle two week . Sham group receive non-invasive treatment procedure . All subject follow 4 week . Main outcome measure : VAS neck pain intensity week 3 serf primary outcome . VAS time point , NPQ score SF-36 week 1 , 2 , 3 , 6 , adverse event analyze secondary outcome . Data analysis : Analysis 'intention treat ' principle . T-test mixed-effect model analysis use measure primary secondary outcome respectively . Expected result : Five session sinew acupuncture treatment significantly reduce neck pain intensity , improve neck pain disability quality life without obvious side effect .
